text: Barbados competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Swimming== Barbados entered four swimmers. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Jack Kirby |align=left|50 m backstroke |26.52 |48 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m backstroke |56.25 |42 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=2|Alex Sobers |align=left|200 m freestyle |1:51.89 |46 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|400 m freestyle |3:58.97 |36 |colspan=2 |colspan=2|Did not advance |} ;Women {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Danielle Titus |align=left|100 m backstroke |1:03.66 |43 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|200 m backstroke |2:25.13 |38 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=2|Danielle Treasure |align=left|200 m freestyle |2:11.51 |46 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|400 m freestyle |4:37.22 |40 |colspan=2 |colspan=2|Did not advance |} ==References== Category:Nations at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships Category:Barbados at the World Aquatics Championships World Aquatics Championships
